snippet.textDisplay:
1) Megaman X.   Loved exploring and re-exploring the stages, and how much mobility you have in that game (dash-jumping off walls, etc.).
2) Woodman in MM2; I absolutely  loved how you could 1-shot him with Heatman's charged up weapon :P
3) Probably something from X, though it's been a while since I've played any of them.
4) Protoman with his light saber and (presumably) Jedi powers.  "This isn't the robot master you're looking for." // *ping ping ping* (as Megaman's shots are reflected right back at him).
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: 1) Megaman 9 ("but why not 2 or 3" Because 2 wasn't THAT good. It was the first game to nail the megaman formula right, but some things weren't that good, such as the overpowered metal blades, the upsetting ending, wily stage 4, the fact all the bosses are too easy, etc. Megaman 3 was about as good, IMO, but it had friggin' top man. And the doc robots. 9was the series's grand return, thank god.) 2) Tough call, but I'd say skull man. 3) TITLE SCREEN FROM MEGAMAN 3 THATS ONE OF MY FAVORITE VGMS O
